quizzes.title: Program Purpose & Timeline
quizzes.summary: Confirm how EB-5 investment delivers jobs, conditional residency, and the window to remove conditions.

questions.question: What core policy objective does the EB-5 Immigrant Investor Program serve?
options: Stimulating U.S. economic growth through job-creating investment
Providing grants to state and local governments
Financing U.S. Treasury securities with foreign capital
Offering guaranteed profits to immigrant investors

questions.question: How long is conditional permanent residency typically granted after the I-526E petition is approved?
options: Two years
Six months
Five years
Ten years

questions.question: When must an EB-5 investor file Form I-829 to remove conditions on residency?
options: During the 90-day period immediately before the conditional green card expires
Within 30 days after entering the United States
Only after the project distributes all profits
At the same time as the I-526E petition

quizzes.title: Investment Thresholds & Sustainment
quizzes.summary: Review minimum capital amounts, sustainment rules, and what "at risk" really means for EB-5 capital.

questions.question: What is the current minimum investment amount for a project located in a Targeted Employment Area (TEA)?
What is the standard minimum investment amount for non-TEA projects under the Reform and Integrity Act?
Which statement accurately reflects the EB-5 "at-risk" capital requirement?
options: Capital must be subject to gain or loss throughout the sustainment period without contractual guarantees
Capital can be withdrawn once construction is finished
Capital is considered at risk if held in any U.S. bank account
Capital may be guaranteed by a developer as long as interest is paid

quizzes.title: Job Creation Playbook
quizzes.summary: Differentiate direct, indirect, and induced jobs and align them with USCIS evidence expectations.

questions.question: Which positions qualify for job counting in a direct EB-5 project?
options: Full-time W-2 employees hired by the new commercial enterprise
Independent contractors retained for seasonal work
Jobs created outside the United States by foreign affiliates
Any position projected by an economic impact model

questions.question: How can a regional center EB-5 project count indirect jobs?
options: By using an accepted economic model that converts project spending into job equivalents
By hiring more part-time workers directly
By counting jobs created by subcontractors overseas
By guaranteeing a fixed number of jobs in the loan agreement

questions.question: What is the standard USCIS expectation for the EB-5 job creation timeframe?
options: Jobs should be created within roughly two years of the investor becoming a conditional resident, with limited extensions when justified
Jobs must be created within six months of the I-526E filing
Jobs may be created any time before the project repays the EB-5 loan
Jobs only need to be projected and never verified

quizzes.title: Direct vs. Regional Center Models
quizzes.summary: Contrast investor responsibilities, job counting methods, and operational control between direct and regional center projects.

questions.question: What is a defining characteristic of a direct EB-5 investment?
options: The investor is actively involved in managing the new commercial enterprise
Investors pool funds through a federally approved regional center
Indirect jobs automatically count without evidence
A third-party manager assumes all operational duties

questions.question: Which advantage is unique to a regional center EB-5 structure?
options: Ability to pool capital and count indirect as well as induced jobs
Lower minimum investment compared to TEA projects
Exemption from annual reporting to USCIS
Guaranteed repayment terms backed by the center

questions.question: Which scenario best represents a direct EB-5 project?
options: An investor opens and manages a franchise restaurant employing new staff
A hotel developer raises capital through a regional center loan fund
A fund buys municipal bonds to finance public infrastructure
A venture capital fund deploys EB-5 money across multiple startups

quizzes.title: Equity vs. Debt Positions
quizzes.summary: Judge how return profiles, collateral, and repayment waterfalls differ between equity and debt EB-5 offerings.

questions.question: How do EB-5 equity investors typically earn a return?
options: Through profit distributions after senior debts are serviced
Through fixed interest payments guaranteed by the developer
Through government-issued tax credits
Through annual USCIS stipends

questions.question: Which feature is most associated with an EB-5 debt offering?
options: A fixed repayment schedule with collateral pledged to the loan
Voting rights over all project decisions
Unlimited upside tied directly to project profitability
Absence of any third-party oversight

questions.question: What is one advantage of a diversified capital stack that includes senior debt, EB-5 debt, and developer equity?
options: It aligns stakeholders with different incentives, distributing risk across multiple layers
It automatically guarantees the EB-5 portion will be repaid first
It removes the need for economic impact studies
It eliminates USCIS scrutiny of offering documents

quizzes.title: Capital Stack Controls
quizzes.summary: Interpret senior lender covenants, monitor construction draws, and spot healthy bridge finance usage.

questions.question: What claim does a senior construction lender hold in a typical EB-5 capital stack?
options: First priority on project cash flows and collateral
Equal priority with developer equity
A subordinated claim behind EB-5 investors
Only a guarantor role without collateral

questions.question: Why do sophisticated lenders require an independent construction monitor?
options: To validate budgets, schedules, and draw requests against actual progress
To guarantee the project finishes ahead of schedule
To replace the developer’s on-site superintendent
To market the project to retail investors

questions.question: How is bridge financing commonly used in an EB-5 project?
options: To start construction while EB-5 subscriptions are still being raised
To pay investor immigration attorney fees
To cover unrelated corporate debt
To guarantee EB-5 investors a fixed return

quizzes.title: Source of Funds Fundamentals
quizzes.summary: Lay the groundwork for lawful source narratives, including gifts, salary savings, and retained earnings.

questions.question: What is the cornerstone requirement for proving a lawful source of EB-5 capital?
options: Providing a credible paper trail that links the funds to lawful activity
Obtaining a notarized letter from any bank
Having the regional center certify the funds
Showing the investor’s passport stamps

questions.question: When EB-5 funds are received as a gift, what documentation is typically expected?
options: Gift deed and donor financial records establishing the donor’s lawful source
Only a verbal confirmation from the donor
A statement from the regional center
Proof that the gift was sent in cryptocurrency

questions.question: How should long-term salary savings be documented for EB-5 purposes?
options: Provide employment contracts, payroll records, and bank statements showing accumulation
Present a personal affidavit without supporting evidence
Transfer the funds through multiple shell companies
Use cash deposits with no explanation

quizzes.title: Path of Funds Documentation
quizzes.summary: Trace every transfer with bank statements, currency conversions, and tax filings that withstand RIA scrutiny.

questions.question: Which evidence best demonstrates the path of funds into an EB-5 escrow account?
options: Sequential bank statements showing each transfer from origin to escrow
A spreadsheet prepared without bank corroboration
An attorney letter with no attachments
A cash withdrawal receipt only

questions.question: What is a best practice when converting foreign currency for an EB-5 investment?
options: Document the exchange with official bank receipts and note the conversion rate used
Rely on an oral agreement with a currency exchanger
Deposit cash directly without conversion proof
Wait to document the conversion until the I-829 stage

questions.question: How should investors evidence tax compliance related to their EB-5 capital?
options: Provide filed tax returns or tax clearance certificates covering the funds’ origin
Submit only unaudited personal spreadsheets
Request the regional center to certify tax status
Avoid disclosing tax records to USCIS

quizzes.title: Complex Source Strategies
quizzes.summary: Handle property sales, secured loans, and layered family contributions without breaking the evidentiary chain.

questions.question: What documentation should accompany a property sale used to fund an EB-5 investment?
options: Sales contract, deed, closing statement, and proof of tax paid on the transaction
Only a letter from the buyer
A general appraisal with no sale evidence
A verbal statement from the developer

questions.question: Which condition must a personal loan meet to qualify as EB-5 capital?
options: It must be secured by the investor’s own assets with executed loan agreements
It must be unsecured and guaranteed by the project
It must be issued by a foreign government
It must be denominated in U.S. dollars only

questions.question: How should investors present multiple layered funding sources?
options: Prepare a chronological narrative with supporting evidence for each layer of funds
Provide one affidavit summarizing all sources without attachments
Combine all funds into cash before documenting
Rely solely on the regional center’s compliance report

quizzes.title: At-Risk Capital Guardrails
quizzes.summary: Ensure redeployment, guarantees, and reserve policies comply with RIA integrity standards.

questions.question: Why does a guaranteed buy-back of EB-5 capital violate the at-risk requirement?
options: Because it removes the possibility of loss or gain tied to project performance
Because USCIS prohibits any exit strategy
Because guarantees are only allowed after I-829 approval
Because it prevents investors from earning interest

questions.question: What should occur when EB-5 capital is repaid before the sustainment period ends?
options: Funds must be redeployed into another qualified at-risk activity
Funds must remain idle in escrow until I-829 approval
Funds must be refunded to investors within 30 days
Funds may be transferred to the developer’s personal account

questions.question: Which redeployment option best aligns with USCIS policy guidance?
options: Reinvesting in another commercial enterprise with similar risk and job creation potential
Purchasing passive market securities with guaranteed returns
Holding cash in a non-interest-bearing account
Loaning funds to the developer’s unrelated side business

quizzes.title: Governance & Fund Administration
quizzes.summary: Evaluate the oversight ecosystem: independent administrators, audited reports, and investor disclosures.

questions.question: What is the primary benefit of engaging an independent fund administrator?
options: Providing third-party oversight of disbursements and recordkeeping
Marketing the project to overseas agents
Guaranteeing investor returns
Eliminating the need for financial reporting

questions.question: Which disclosure should appear in an EB-5 subscription agreement?
options: Detailed use of proceeds, fee schedules, and exit mechanics
Personal opinions about market trends
Unverified testimonials from past investors
Only the project’s architectural plans

questions.question: How often should investors expect project-level reporting under best practices?
options: On a scheduled basis (e.g., quarterly) summarizing construction, expenditures, and job creation
Only once at the I-829 filing
Whenever the developer has marketing news
Reporting is optional after I-526E approval

quizzes.title: Immigration Petition Mastery
quizzes.summary: Sequence every filing from I-526E through I-829 and choose the right processing path for each family.

questions.question: Which sequence accurately reflects the EB-5 immigration process?
options: I-526E approval → visa issuance or status adjustment → conditional residence → I-829 adjudication
Consular interview → I-829 → I-526E → conditional residence
I-829 → unconditional green card → I-526E → visa issuance
Conditional residence → I-526E → visa issuance → I-829

questions.question: When is adjustment of status available instead of consular processing?
options: When the investor is lawfully present in the United States with an immigrant visa number available
Whenever the investor prefers to avoid travel
Only after the I-829 filing
When the investor holds a visitor visa and has not filed I-526E

questions.question: Which family members can obtain derivative status through the principal EB-5 investor?
options: Spouse and unmarried children under 21
Parents of the principal investor
Married children regardless of age
Any extended family member listed in the business plan
